data.question: What is the main advantage of optical imaging over X-ray computed tomography and positron emission tomography?
data.answer: Optical imaging uses neither ionizing radiation nor radioactive materials.

data.question: Why do dye-loaded nanoparticles represent a solution for detecting low concentrations of biological targets in optical imaging?
data.answer: Because they can carry a large payload of dye molecules and target certain cell types by conjugation to affinity molecules.

data.question: True or False: Most fluorescent dye molecules have large Stokes shifts and do not suffer from self-quenching.
What was the dye loading percentage for the zinc-based nanoscale coordination polymers?
What method was used to synthesize the bulk zinc coordination polymer with the formula [Zn2L-(C2O4)2]·2 dmf·3 H2O?
data.answer: By allowing Zn(NO3)2 and [L-H2](PF6)2 to react in a dimethylformamide and H2O mixture in a screw-capped vial at 90°C for two days.

data.question: True or False: The zirconium-based nanoscale coordination polymers were not stabilized with a silica coating.
What was the purpose of functionalizing the silica-coated zirconium NCP with poly(ethylene glycol) (PEG) and a targeting molecule?
data.answer: For in vitro optical imaging of cancer cells.

data.question: True or False: The luminescent quantum yield of NCP-2 was reported to be 0.8%.
What was the half-life of the as-synthesized particles of 2 in 8 mm phosphate-buffered saline at 37°C?
How was the stability of NCP-2 under coating conditions confirmed?
data.answer: By TGA, EDS, DLS, and release profile data.

data.question: True or False: The silica coating on NCP-2 particles did not provide surface silanol groups for further functionalization.
What was the observed effect of PEG-SiO2@2 and AA-PEG-SiO2@2 on H460 human non-small-cell lung cancer cells after 24 hours of incubation?
data.answer: They did not lead to any appreciable cell death.

data.question: True or False: Significant MLCT luminescent signal was observed in H460 cells incubated with non-targeted PEG-SiO2@2.
What was the main conclusion of the study regarding the potential use of nanoscale coordination polymers?
data.answer: They are a novel platform for the design of luminescent hybrid nanoparticles with extremely high dye loadings for optical imaging.

data.question: True or False: The anisamide-targeted particles showed no cancer specificity in uptake studies and confocal microscopy of H460 cells in vitro.
What was the method used for the synthesis of the phosphorescent ruthenium complex?
data.answer: By treating 5,5’-(CO2Et)2-bpy with [Ru(bpy)2Cl2] and subsequent acid-catalyzed hydrolysis and anion exchange.

data.question: True or False: The zirconium-based NCPs had a dye loading percentage of 57.4%.
What was the average luminescence lifetime of NCP-1 monitored at 630 nm?
Why were NCP-1 particles not stable under the coating conditions?
data.answer: Because the L dye molecules leached from the particles, and the recovered particles were nearly colorless.

data.question: True or False: The study demonstrated that nanoscale coordination polymers could not be used as contrast agents for optical imaging.
